p: To inform the design of the study and to plan dissemination at community-level, a group of ten traditional leaders received training in medical research ethics and were invited to constitute a Community Advisory Board. Qualitative research carried out among this group explored the drivers of acceptability to engage in research that may involve collection, transport, storage, and use of blood samples, i.e. the factors that could directly impact the successful establishment and operation of the biobank of blood samples. The study revealed that the concerns centred primarily around three themes.
